import os
# === Parameters from pipeline ===
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

from notebookutils import mssparkutils


# --------------------------
# Manual defaults for testing
# --------------------------
# Python notebook code
file_name  = globals().get("fileName")
state_name = "FL"
file_date  = "20251010"
print(f"File: {file_name}, State: {state_name}, Date: {file_date}")


if file_name is None:
    print(f"invalid file name or path")
    raise ValueError("Parameter 'file_name' is required.")

# Optional for JDBC URL if using environment variables or pipeline
# dbutils.widgets.text("jdbcUrl", "")
# dbutils.widgets.text("targetTable", "")

#targetDB


#jdbc_url     = os.environ.get("SQL_JDBC_URL")
#target_table = os.environ.get("SQL_TABLE")
# === ADLS configuration ===
container = "synapse1"
account = "alexanalytics1"  # without .dfs.core.windows.net
folder = "synapse/workspaces/alex-analytics1"
file_path = f"abfss://{container}@{account}.dfs.core.windows.net/{folder}/{file_name}"

# === Read CSV with schema inferred ===
df = (spark.read
      .option("header", "true")
      .option("inferSchema", "true")
      .option("quote", '"')
      .option("escape", '\\')
      .csv(file_path))
print("Read CSV File")
df.show()

# === Add metadata columns ===
from pyspark.sql.functions import lit, current_timestamp, trim
df = (df
      .withColumn("SourceState", lit(state_name))
      .withColumn("SourceFileDate", lit(file_date))
      .withColumn("IngestionTimestamp", current_timestamp()))

# === Simple transformation: trim all string columns ===
for col in df.columns:
    df = df.withColumn(col, trim(df[col]))

# === SQL Server connection ===
jdbc_url = "jdbc:sqlserver://dths-test-sqlserver.database.windows.net:1433;databaseName=dths;encrypt=true;trustServerCertificate=false;authentication=ActiveDirectoryMsi"
target_table = "dbo.batches"

# === Write to SQL Server efficiently ===
(df.write
   .format("jdbc")
   .mode("append")
   .option("url", jdbc_url)
   .option("dbtable", target_table)
   .option("batchsize", 5000)
   .save())

print(f"Data successfully written to {target_table}")

# === Archive processed file ===
source_path = f"{folder}/{file_name}"
archive_path = f"{folder}/archive/{file_name}"
mssparkutils.fs.mkdirs(f"abfss://{container}@{account}.dfs.core.windows.net/{folder}/archive")
mssparkutils.fs.mv(
    f"abfss://{container}@{account}.dfs.core.windows.net/{source_path}",
    f"abfss://{container}@{account}.dfs.core.windows.net/{archive_path}"
)
print(f"Moved file to archive: {archive_path}")
